text: hello this week I'd like to talk about
what it takes to make an artifact be
considered a work of art and to do that
I want to focus on Kim Kardashian's
bottom which let's face it has been
tricky to miss this week I'm not trying
to break the Internet as she said she
was with this photo shoot nor am i
trying to trade on her celebrity as this
art website rather hypocritically
accused the Met Museum of doing when it
tweeted this image of one of its
artifacts from its collection 6,000 year
old marble sculpture which it describes
as having a fleshy abdomen and massive
thighs and buttocks and then there was
the big splash on Wednesday in the Sun
newspaper claiming that miss Kardashian
is going to have an artistic molding
made of her bottom to give to her
husband the pop star Kanye West as a
gift now there's nothing new in the art
world of having an alluring image of
yourself commissioned to give to a loved
one mozart commissioned this tiny
portrait when his 21 to give to his
first love maria mozart who also had to
be his first cousin and Queen Victoria
who we tend to think of like this an
intimidating regal Grand Am commissioned
the German portrait painter France
vinter halter to make this rather
seductive image of her Queen Victoria
wrote in her journal that August that
Prince Albert thought it was a
beautifully painted picture and she felt
so happy and proud to have found
something that gave him so much pleasure
a sentiment I expect that Kim hopes to
evoke with her gift to Kanye which is
great but is it art the Mozart and
Victoria portraits are art they're
paintings but is a molding of her bottom
I mean some moldings are art even of the
more explicit nature
take for example Marcel Duchamp's female
fig leaf which can be found in a take
gallery collection but I don't think
anybody in the art world would seriously
consider the waxworks in Madame Tussauds
to be fine art sculptures nor for that
matter
I expect the moldings of Cynthia plastic
aster I'll leave you to check that out
but then mark Quinn's Kate Moss is
considered art so what's the difference
well in my opinion an artwork should
have no use beyond itself it should have
no functional purpose and of course an
artist has to say that it is an artwork
like Marcel Duchamp famously did with
his urinal and thirdly I think there has
to be a sense of artistic intervention
or at least an interpretation so back
again with Marcel Duchamp's urinal he
stopped having any functional use
whatsoever and he changed his context by
putting it into an art gallery and
calling it a work of art now I don't
think the two swords mannequins passed
any of those three tests no I suspect to
Cynthia's plaster casts although I have
to admit I've never seen one that said
the elevation of artifact to artwork is
slightly easier when it comes to
portraiture where the sitter is often
considered more important than the
artist so might Kim Kardashian's molded
bottom be considered an artwork
well yes I think it could be if Jeff
Koons is commissioned to do the work
probably not if it's done by Cynthia
plastic caster and definitely not if it
has any sort of functional purpose
